results.title: Lead poisoning: the hidden epidemic
results.brief_description: The film for the first time puts the problem of lead poisoning in young children in its proper perspective with an authentic “case history” of the problems in all its aspects. Through scenes and persons the comments of physicians and laboratory technicians, the film shows why lead poisoning is so often undetected and goes on killing untold numbers of children.

results.title: Lea L'hiver = Lea, in Winter
results.creator_credit: Marc Monnet, Francis Girod and Jacques Rouffio
results.brief_description:
On a Spanish island, a young French woman has died after falling from a cliff. The local police inspector is asked to solve the case quickly and quietly, so as not to disturb tourism. As the investigation seeks to find out whether this was an accidental death, a murder or a suicide, the inspector is forced to look into the long list of the victim’s lovers.

Credits: Producers, Jacques Rouffio, Francis Girod ; director, Marc Monnet ; writer, Marc Monnet ; photography, Claude Beausoleil ; music, Olivier Bloch-Laine.
Cast: Karen Blanguernon, Gilles Segal, Monique Melinand, Jean-Claude Bouillon, Hente Sonderland, Jacques Higelin, Louis Daquin.

results.title: Le Voyage a Paimpol = the Journey to Paimpol
results.brief_description:
Maryvonne works hard in a factory and one day meets and eventually falls for an attractive Algerian co-worker. Meanwhile, the workers at the factory go on strike, and Maryvonne fantasizes that she is leading them Joan of Arc-style, or as a Russian revolutionary. When a journalist arrives to record the strike, he encourages Maryvonne to write her account of the matters at hand. The journalist is based in Paimpol, and as Maryvonne travels to meet him, her dreams and his reality are set on a collision course.

Credits: Producer, Dominique Laurent ; director, John Berry ; writers, Josiane Leveque, John Berry ; photography, Bernard Zitzerman ; music, Serge Franklin.
Cast: Myriam Boyer, Michel Boujenah, Jean-Francois Garreaud, Dora Doll, Michele Brousse.

results.title: Le Vol D'icare (TV Version)
results.brief_description:
Icare is the creation of a famous Parisian writer. While his master is otherwise engaged with an afternoon ‘rendez-vous’, Icare slips off the page and into the street. The writer suspecting that Icare’s flight is in fact the result of plagiarism engages dectective Morcol to try and locate the runaway hero.

Credits: Director, writer, Daniel Ceccaldi ; music, Claude Bolling.
Cast: Michel Galabru, Caroline Cellier, Henri Garcin, Evelyne Buyle, Roger Carel, Piere Mallet.

results.title: Le Territoire des Autres = the Territory of Others
results.creator_credit: Francois Bel, Gerard Vienne and Michel Fano
results.brief_description:
Filmed around the world, this documentary is a patient observation of animals in their natural habitat. It is also a plea in favour of conservation and the creation of animal sanctuaries as the creatures of nature face the biggest enemy in humans who pollute and show callous disregard for the sanctity of wildlife and conservation. Awards: Grand Prix de la Commission Superieure Technique, Cannes 1970.

Credits: Directors, Michel Fano, Gerard Vienne, Francois Bel ; photography, Jacqueline Lecompte.

results.title: Le Sucre = the Sugar
results.creator_credit: Jacques Rouffio, Lise Fayolle and Georgio Silvagni
results.brief_description:
Adrien, a wealthy retiree, meets Raoul, a hot-shot commodities broker who sweet talks him into speculating on the recent rise in sugar prices. Grezillo, the “sugar king” is using the rumour mill to create panic buying of sugar and maintain the prices at high level. Adrien sees his capital double in value and decides to use Raoul’s scheme again. But the market turns around …

Credits: Producers, Georgio Silvagni, Lise Fayolle ; director, Jacques Rouffio ; writers, Georges Conchon, Jacques Rouffio ; photography, Rene Mathelin ; music, Philippe Sarde.
Cast: Gerard Depardieu, Jean Carmet, Michel Piccoli, Nelly Borgeaud, Roger Hanin, Marthe Villalonga, Claude Pieplu, Georges Descrieres, Jean-Paul Muel, Toni Taffin.

results.title: Le retour de Surcouf = Cyclone on the Indian Ocean (Cinemascope Print)
results.brief_description:
The British have taken hold of Mahe, a French possession in the Indian Ocean. Surcouf is sent to rescue secrets documents detailing the whole French military set up in the region before it falls into ennemy hands.

Credits: Director, Sergio Bergonzelli ; writers, Jacques Severac, George de la Giraudiere, J. A. de la Loma ; music, Georges Garvarentz.
Cast: Gerard Barray, Antonella Lualdi, Genevieve Casile.

results.title: Le Rat D'amerique = the Rat Trap
results.brief_description:
Charles migrates to Paraguay. He meets Maria, a young cashier in money changing outlet and falls in love with her. Short of money and short on prospects, Charles becomes involved in a gun smuggling

Credits: Director, Jean-Gabriel Albicocco ; writers, Jacques Lanzmann, Jean-Gabriel Albicocco ; photography, Quinto Albicocco ; music, Georges Garvarentz.
Cast: Charles Aznavour, Marie Laforet, Franco Fabrizzi.

results.title: Le Quatrieme Pouvoir
results.brief_description:
Yves Dorget, a newspaper reporter and Catherine Carre, a TV anchorwoman are both investigating the assassination of an Arab leader, who opposed the sale of two French nuclear reactors to his country. The pair become convinced that the French Secret Services are involved in the assassination, and just as they are getting a little too close to the truth, an order comes from ‘the castle’ to shut down the investigation.

Credits: Producer, Jean Kerchner ; director, Serge Leroy ; writers, Yannick Flot, Serge Leroy, Francoise Giroud ; photography, Andre Domage ; music, Alain Bashung.
Cast: Philippe Noiret, Nicole Garcia, Jean-Claude Brialy, Roland Blanche, Bernard Freyd.

results.title: Le Portrait de Marianne = the Picture of Marianne
results.brief_description:
Octave has just been ‘dumped’ by his wife, Marianne. Together with his good friend Alfred, they go looking for her across Paris. As their conversation unfolds, they attempts to make sense of their relationships with women.

Credits: Producer, Eric Geiger ; director, Daniel Goldenberg ; writers, Daniel Goldenberg, Edgar de Bresson ; photography, Georges Barsky ; music, Philippe Carson.
Cast: Claude Brasseur, Karen Blanguernon, Bernard Fresson, Liliane Rovere, Jacques Rispal.
